an6.94:4.1: “Mendicants, these six things can’t be done.
an6.94:4.3: A person accomplished in view can’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They can’t maliciously shed the blood of the Realized One. They can’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They can’t acknowledge another teacher.
an6.94:4.4: These are the six things that can’t be done.”
